author: bigpey
title: Atrium - The Center of Everything
description: Cardano needs to simplify its user experience. There are too many cluttered dApps, wallets and data feeds. Users need a simple, elegant, data aggregator for all things Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of ​​the proposal is great. There are too many Daaps, wallets, and feeds on Cardano nowadays so users need a simpler, data aggregator. The solution was to build a dashboard to display all wallet and Defi information in a clean, simple interface. Aggregates market data to enable a holistic view of decentralized life. Propose shows a legitimate problem and then provides an idea of ​​a valid solution. Atrium is like a home, where all your wallet activities will be centralized, the central room connected to your decentralized life. Here it shows your NFT portfolio, profit product performance, and where you can find other opportunities in the market. Doing this benefits the end-user by making things simpler, but it also helps create more efficient markets as arbitrage opportunities are discovered more quickly. The problem has been identified and a solution is well explained, even completely clear and consistent with the objective of the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a very interesting proposition. It effectively solves the challenge being faced. f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer wants to build a Dashboard where the users can display their wallet and DEFI information in a clean and simple interface. It will also have an aggregator to find the best deals across the Cardano ecosystem. I concur with the proposer that there is a need for a Dashboard like service as DEXes and other platforms on Cardano are increasing over time, and it is getting difficult for people to manage their decentralized portfolio if they are using multiple exchanges and protocols. Hence it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and help the people using the DEFI protocols. It also aligns with the Challenge as it involves the creation of a product to benefit Cardano users.

The proposer did not provide a detailed plan on how he would achieve the protocol mentioned above. He just said he intends to launch the application that will integrate and provide a central location and aggregator for DEX's, NFT Projects, Liquidity, and Lending Protocols. This is not appropriate for any proposal, especially for a proposal with such a big budget. On the other hand, the stated budget details are based on the type of expenses and not on the identifiable tasks. Hence I suggest the proposer first provide a detailed plan which should be segregated based on the milestone and timeframe. Then he should assign the required amount for each task or at least for each milestone.

Because of the above fact, I cannot agree or disagree with the impact criteria of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is known in the Cardano community; he runs Stakepools and has a YouTube channel on which he provides Cardano-related content. Also, team members are part of some other Cardano projects. Hence he and his team seem to be capable of executing this proposal. But it would have been better if he had provided the LinkedIn profiles of team members for the community to check.

As mentioned above, the proposer did not provide a detailed plan and just described what he intended to do in a sentence. This is inconclusive information, and it would have been better if he had provided a step-by-step technical plan divided into different phases/milestones per the Catalyst's best practices. The provided timeframe is also vague and stated only in quarters.

The requested budget is enormous and does not seem reasonable for the above initiative. Also, it is segregated based on the type of expenses and not on identifiable tasks of the detailed plan. Hence, the provided information is insufficient to decide on this proposal's feasibility. Therefore I cannot agree or disagree.
f6_assessments.q2:
In the auditability section, the proposer stated he would measure the progress of the proposal with the site launch & access and First DEX & NFT integration. This can be the success criteria post-execution of the proposal. But no details or metrics are stated regarding auditing/tracking the proposal's progress while under execution.

The provided delivery dates are vague and have only been mentioned in quarters. Although, as per the details, the protocol will launch in Q3-Q4 this year, this has to be more specific. Moreover, the selected proposal will get the funds in Sept-22. So, the proposer can only start the work in Q4 unless he has already started with his funds.

Because of the above facts, it is impossible to audit the proposal's progress due to the lack of a detailed plan, auditability information, and budget break-up.

f6_assessments.q0: I would agree that there is a current challenge in the Cardano community where simplicity can be beneficial. Right now, there are so many projects being built on Cardano and it can be hard to filter between the good and bad. It would be beneficial to have all the data stored in a single place. I believe the Atrium could become something that most Cardano users will use to help find at which marketplace you will find the best deal. I'm unsure if there are other projects currently working on this same idea, but it could be crucial to the early ecosystem. It could potentially have a global impact and become a feature that all Cardano users utilize daily. For these reasons, I give this section 4 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q2: Without the familiarity of the idea within the community. It will be hard for accountability to play a big role in this proposal. The roadmap and delivery dates are very clear and there is a lot of information describing where the potential funds will be allocated. If the team will remain open with their community and give frequent updates of progression, it is likely that this proposal will be successful and there will be a lot of utility brought into the Cardano ecosystem. f6_assessments.q0: The proposer wants to address the problem that there is no simple data aggregator from Cardano. As a solution, the submitter wants a dashboard to display all your wallet and DeFi information in one clean, simple interface. The submitter wants to offer a place via Atrium where all your activities from your wallet are recorded. (+ NFT portfolio included) This solution could have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem for people who already work with Cardano and would need a better overview. The rapid growth of the Cardano ecosystem makes it difficult for individuals to find these tools and keep up with new tools as they appear. Atrium could be a solution for this. The goals correspond to the outlined challenges setting. Some risks are included such as the rapid development of new projects and applications. To solve this problem, this project will have to work together with new and existing projects. I think the danger of projects not wanting to work with Atrium should be included. There is always a danger to this and that can prevent this project from being successful.
f6_assessments.q1: The people who will participate in this project are included. It says some what function these people will have in carrying out this proposal. There are no links included where you can find their experience. The proposer has not recognisably included the type of team members needed to implement this proposal. A budget plan is available. There is not enough explanation about how everything will be done. The budget seems way too big. For example, it says that 2 frontend developers will get $100,000 within 6 months. There is nothing recorded about the number of hours on which everything will be worked. It would be helpful to include the working hours to make a fairer budgeting. The budget is certainly large enough to achieve all objectives. It states in the proposal what the funding will be used for (resources) There will be a return for further funding if this project were to be expanded. The timetable is unclear. Because it concerns such a large financing, it should have been worked out in much more detail. There is no sensible implementation plan included that shows what and how everything will be done. Almost no technical aspects are included that are crucial for the implementation. There are risks included in the proposal. (application volume, new projects being developed at a rapid pace) The most important thing that should still be included is for what would happen if projects do not want to participate in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A limited roadmap with milestones is included in the proposal. Before applying for such a large financing, I would expect that everything would have been written out in more detail. Some KPIs are included to measure success. The KPIs are unclear to me. For such a large project, I would expect to include many more KPIs and share the results as transparently as possible with the community. The submitter clearly describes the problem that there is no simple data aggregator from Cardano. The submitter wants Atrium to solve this problem. I currently think there is not enough information to prove that this team can accomplish the proposal. There is little transparency in this proposal to ensure that the funding will be put to good use.
